title: Seriously Asian: Stir-frying Vegetables
summary: Seriously Asian: Stir-frying Vegetables might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 1. One serving contains 526 calories, 15g of protein, and 44g of fat. For $5.03 per serving, this recipe covers 44% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 20 minutes. This recipe is liked by 18 foodies and cooks. Head to the store and pick up qtwater, garlic, oyster sauce, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the water you could follow this main course with the Watermelon-Peach Slushies as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, whole 30, and pescatarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 95%, this dish is spectacular. Try Pork and Stir-Fried Vegetables with Spicy Asian Sauce, Asian Stir-Fry No-Fry, and Asian Stir Fry for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are great choices for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. You could try Domaine Weinbach Cuvee Laurence Gewurztraminer. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 54 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Domaine Weinbach Cuvee Laurence Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description:
The aromas are evocative with notes of rose petals and exotic fruit. Slightly off-dry on the palate, this vintage unveils a bouquet of ripe cantaloupe, guava, and nectarine aromas which are balanced with delicate spices such as ginger and cardamom. The finish is long and elegant.
This Gewurztraminer is versatile and can be paired with smoked salmon as well as ginger-braised pork, Southeast Asian cuisine such as red coconut curry, Indian, or Moroccan-style dishes. Also great on its own, as an aperitif, or with foie grasand rich, mature cheeses.
